To be honest, I am not impressed.  The restaurant is very nice and elegant but the food was not what we expected from this calibre.  The service was also not on point.  We would have expected more.

Ambience and service are superb! Staff was friendly and funny. They allow children to dine here. It is children friendly but when a baby kept crying it became disturbing. The food was well presented that covers land and sea with fresh ingredients.  Couple of dishes we really liked such as the shrimp and caviar appetizer and the lamb dish as entree. However overall food tastes were not impressive. I am surprised that this restaurant keeps its 3 starts for that long. Maybe the stars are for its location and service.

Le Louis XV by chef Alain Ducasse is located in Hotel de Paris. This unique restaurant has been awarded many times and currently has 3 Michelin stars. The restaurant has a limited number of tables in a small area but the ceiling is high and stylish. I can say that this restaurant provided the best service among the restaurants I have been to in my life. The staff were professionals and knew every detail on the menu. We tried the agape menu. The chef also had surprises so the tasting journey was 3 hours. To be honest the plates looked better than it tasted. Some flavors were too strong and we could not eat some of the dishes. It's pricey but worth a visit once. Overall it was an interesting experience.
Unbelievable experience! If money isnâ€™t an issue, food by Alain Ducasse is a must try! Service is amazing, food is delicious, and youâ€™ll see cars that are only seen on tv!
